newsitem.title: JAPAN: Ship damaged after hitting tanker in Yokohama.
newsitem.headline: Ship damaged after hitting tanker in Yokohama.

text.p: A cement-carrying ship suffered serious damage on Saturday after colliding with an oil tanker near Yokohama port, south of Tokyo, a Japan Maritime Safety Agency (MSA) spokesman said.
He said the 3,250-tonne cement carrier Taishomaru sustained a three-metre (yard) diameter breach in its hull extending one metre (yard) below the waterline but was not in danger of sinking.

The 304,810-tonne tanker Ocean Swallow received a minor dent and continued on its way to Singapore. There was no oil leakage following the accident, which occurred three kilometres (two miles) off Yokohama at around 10 a.m.
The cause of the collision was not known. Both ships are registered in Japan.
